meanings.sent1: The child found colorful clumps of flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the clumps of cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The clumps of cotton candy at the fair looked like fluffy clouds.
meanings.sent4: The clumps of stars in the night sky formed beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent5: The hiker stumbled upon clumps of mushrooms along the trail.

meanings.definition: To gather or be gathered into a cluster or mass
meanings.sent1: The students clumps together to discuss the project.
meanings.sent2: The bees clumps around the hive to protect the queen.
meanings.sent3: The children clumps around the teacher during storytime.
meanings.sent4: The clouds clumps together before a storm.
meanings.sent5: The ants clumps around the sugar cube to carry it to their nest.
